meanings.definition: A structure of rough stones stacked in the form of a human figure, used by the Inuit people as a landmark or a commemorative sign.
meanings.sent1: The inukshuks guided the travelers through the snowy landscape.
meanings.sent2: Tourists admired the ancient inukshuks along the trail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel perched on top of the inukshuks, pretending to be the king of the hill.
meanings.sent4: The inukshuks stood tall like silent guardians of the Arctic wilderness.
meanings.sent5: In the fading light, the inukshuks appeared like mystical figures from a forgotten time.

meanings.sent1: The hikers marveled at the many inukshuks dotting the landscape.
meanings.sent2: Local artists created beautiful sculptures inspired by inukshuks.
meanings.sent3: During the festival, the town square was filled with colorful inukshuks made of balloons.
meanings.sent4: The inukshuks in the art gallery seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: In the museum, the exhibit showcased various inukshuks from different regions.
